issue.title: Map get Blank after updating to IOS 17
issue.body:
Hello, I am working on a mobile app that uses Mapbox, it turns out that when updating to IOS 17 the map began to appear blank, this only happens on mobile and on iPhone 14 and above.

mapbox version: "mapbox-gl": "^2.8.1",
react-gl version > "react-map-gl": "^7.0.15",


### Expected Behavior

![image](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/assets/134430625/b0d574c7-e41b-475e-81f5-316a2f1316b4)


### Actual Behavior

![image](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/assets/134430625/8ee073ad-9d1a-4e46-a74e-269e48a46ee9)

comment.body:
> We're getting the same issue in our web application on a regular iOS 17 Safari tab - not a PWA on the homescreen.

Following on from this. It has been fixed in iOS 17.1, without us making any code changes.

issue.title: Tree models should be anchored to custom terrain source
issue.body:
**mapbox-gl-js version**: v3.0.0-beta.1

**browser**: Chrome

### Steps to Trigger Behavior

Add a custom `raster-dem` source, then use it in `setTerrain`.

```
map.addSource('custom-dem', {
  type: 'raster-dem',
  tiles: ['http://localhost:8000/terrain/tiles/{z}/{x}/{y}.webp'],
  tileSize: 256,
  maxzoom: 16
})
map.setTerrain({'source': 'custom-dem', 'exaggeration': 1 })
```

### Link to Demonstration

to be provided if needed

`mapbox://mapbox.mapbox-terrain-dem-v1` terrain source
![2023-08-16_13-16_1](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/assets/117278/347a55f9-1ebb-4deb-8cf2-146e3e938deb)

Custom terrain source
![2023-08-16_13-16](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/assets/117278/d1cab11c-3f79-486e-9734-2f1c20b8c9ce)


### Expected Behavior

Expected that the tree models are anchored to the custom terrain surface.

### Actual Behavior

Tree models are floating above/below the custom terrain surface and not anchored to it.

comment.body: This should be fixed now. @andrewharvey, please reopen if it happens again. Thanks

issue.title: Map style "Standard" adds multiple languages
issue.body: Currently Standard only supports English, we hope to add more languages.

issue.title: 线段在小比例尺下显示为虚线问题
remove marker on popup close causes infinite loop
issue.body:
**mapbox-gl-js version**:
0.53

**browser**: 
Firefox

### Steps to Trigger Behavior

 1. Open popup
 2. Close popup

### Link to Demonstration
https://jsbin.com/nelaqorayi

### Expected Behavior
Marker removed on popup close.

### Actual Behavior
Infinite loop and crash on popup close.

comment.body: @3zzy  Did you find a solution to this? I am facing the same problem.

commits.message: Add negate requirement for flood vs ambient properties set (#12947)

pull_request.title: Add negate requirement for flood vs ambient properties set
pull_request.body:
Providing I understand the intention around ambient vs flood lighting for fill-extrusion types: you can only use one and not the other.

This PR adds a `!` requirement to ambient lighting properties if flood lighting is present & the reverse.

issue.title: setData Trashes Memory -- Dynamic Lines are Unusable
issue.body:
I am trying to dynamically update a simple line (using a geojson source) on each frame, and am seeing constant CPU usage of 200-300%, and animation that starts stuttering after around 20 seconds. It gets increasingly worse, with frames frequently taking several hundred ms after a few minutes runtime.

This happens in both Chrome and Firefox, on both Linux and Mac, with both Mapbox GL JS v2.14 and v3, and with all map styles I've tried.

I see multiple similar issues about this in the past; #12400, #5252, #4618, #2607, and also on Stackoverflow, so it appears this is not a new problem.

The profiler shows that the frame is blocked due to **Major GC**, and memory seems to be allocated by **reloadTile** and its callees in "class G extends e.VectorTileWorkerSource".

![image](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/assets/1812661/af2f6a9c-c83c-4ba6-8693-ad85959a3b14)

Perhaps this is by design, but in that case, is there any other way to dynamically modify a line? I'm trying to render a trivial route line from a moving vehicle on a map, which seems like a core functionality that should work efficiently? Having the UI stutter and freeze for several hundred ms at a time is not acceptable for our use case. The only workaround I've found is to use Three.js in a custom layer to render lines.

Minimum reproducible example below. It calls `setData` each frame with an empty line, and logs any frame taking > 30 ms. After some time (~30 seconds for me), this happens frequently, and if you leave it running for a few minutes there are much longer pauses. Some runs appear to be faster, then refreshing the page could make it slower again. (**Note:** In this code, I call `setData` 100 times per frame which seems to make the issue appear faster, but this is not needed, the same thing happens when called once per frame.)

https://jsbin.com/yegudivudi/edit?html,output

comment.body: (I updated the description above with some more details after doing some debugging.)

forkee.name: mapbox-gl-js
forkee.description: Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps in the browser, powered by vector tiles and WebGL

issue.title: Resource Leak in setData (animated geojson line)
issue.body:
There appears to be a resource or memory leak when calling `setData` to update a line each frame, similar to the [Animate a line](https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/animate-a-line/) example. There are increasingly long pauses (garbage collection?), and after around 20 seconds, animation is visibly stuttering. CPU usage is high, at a constant 200-300%, and memory usage grows to about 1 GB. After a few minutes, there are pauses as long as 1 second.

This happens in both Chrome and Firefox, with both Mapbox GL JS v2.14 and v3, and with all map styles I've tried.

I see multiple similar issues about this in the past; #12400, #5252, #4618, #2607, so it appears there's some issue here that's not fully resolved.

With this issue present, I am unable to use any dynamic lines in my application. Any solution or workaround would be great. (The only workaround I came up with was to draw lines using Three.js in a custom layer.)

Minimum reproducible example below. It calls `setData` each frame, and logs any frame taking > 30 ms. After about 30 seconds, this happens frequently, and if you leave it running for a few minutes there are much longer pauses. (Some runs appear to be faster, then refreshing the page makes it slower again.) (**Note:** In this code, I call `setData` 100 times per frame to make the issue appear faster, but this is not needed, it will happen regardless.)

https://jsbin.com/yegudivudi/edit?html,output

pull_request.title: Create deno.yml
pull_request.body:
> Launch Checklist

<!-- Thanks for the PR! Feel free to add or remove items from the checklist. -->

 - briefly describe the changes in this PR
 - [x] include before/after visuals or gifs if this PR includes visual changes
 -  write tests for all new functionality
 - [x] document any changes to public APIs
 - [x] post benchmark scores
 - [x] manually test the debug page
 - [x] tagged `@mapbox/map-design-team` `@mapbox/static-apis` if this PR includes style spec API or visual changes
 - [x] tagged `@mapbox/gl-native` if this PR includes shader changes or needs a native port
 - [x] apply changelog label ('bug', 'feature', 'docs', etc) or use the label 'skip changelog'
 - [x] add an entry inside this element for inclusion in the `mapbox-gl-js` changelog: `<changelog></changelog>`
